item.title: How I Decreased ETL Cost by Leveraging the Apache Arrow Ecosystem
item.description: In the field of Data Engineering, the Apache Spark framework is one of the most known and powerful ways to extract and process data. It is well-trusted, and it is also very simple to use once you get the infrastructure set up. Understandably, most engineers will choose it for every task. However, in a lot of ways, it can be overkill. And a very expensive one.

item.title: Going Fast With Go - an introduction to Golang (slides)
item.description: This is a (small) presentation I gave to my coworkers at CEPESC. At the time, most of the software there was written in Java, and our team (researchers from the Federal University of Brasilia) was developing in Python. I was advocating using Golang in some performance-critical areas of our system.

item.title: Writing LaTeX Documents In Visual Studio Code With LaTeX Workshop
item.description: If you want to write LaTeX on your machine, VS Code is a great option for you! Installing all the necessary packages is a simple process. And with the power of Git, you can sync with web-based editors like Overleaf, and have satisfying versioning and backup.
